goal.en: This course focuses on financial management issues pertaining to multinational corporations (MNCs). Topics include international financial markets, currency risk management, global financing, short-term financial management, and international investment analysis, etc.
goal.ch: This course focuses on financial management issues pertaining to multinational corporations (MNCs). Topics include international financial markets, currency risk management, global financing, short-term financial management, and international investment analysis, etc.

content.en:
• Understand the structures and instruments used in international financial markets including foreign exchange markets, money markets, debt markets, equity markets, and currency derivative markets.
• Identify the factors affecting currency values.
• Measure and manage currency exposure including transaction exposure, operating exposure, and translation exposure.
• Evaluate international investment projects using capital budgeting techniques.
• Discuss the strategic considerations in MNCs‘ long-term financing.
• Discuss short-term financing issues such as working capital optimization
• Other relevant topics: international trade, alliances and acquisitions, etc.
